definitions.text: a popular programming language that is relatively easy to learn; an acronym for beginner's all-purpose symbolic instruction code; no longer in general use
(usually plural) a necessary commodity for which demand is constant
pertaining to or constituting a base or basis
examples: basic changes in public opinion occur because of changes in priorities

definitions.text: reduced to the simplest and most significant form possible without loss of generality
serving as a base or starting point
of or denoting or of the nature of or containing a base
